title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 523.3 - Disciplinary authority
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 523.3 - Disciplinary authority

State Regulations
A lawyer who practices law temporarily in
this State pursuant to this Part shall be subject to the New York Rules of

Professional Conduct and to the disciplinary authority of this State in
connection with such temporary practice to the same extent as if the lawyer
were admitted or authorized to practice in the State. A grievance committee may
report complaints and evidence of a disciplinary violation against a lawyer
practicing temporarily pursuant to this Part to the appropriate disciplinary
authority of any jurisdiction in which the attorney is admitted or authorized
to practice law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
523.3

Adopted

New

York State Register December 30, 2015/Volume XXXVII, Issue 52, eff. 12/30/2015

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
